overview_summary: The neighboring entities include a county conservation authority focused on preserving open land, a small development company holding vacant parcels, and two farm-related LLCs with minimal public profiles. The McHenry County Conservation District wields significant influence and prioritizes environmental and open-space protection. The private LLC owners appear primarily interested in land value and agricultural use, with no overt public stance on development documented.

neighbors.name: Union Operating Co LLC
neighbors.claims: Union Operating Co. LLC is an Illinois limited liability company listed as owner of three farmland parcels in Marengo Township (PINs above) ([mchenryil.devnetwedge.com](https://mchenryil.devnetwedge.com/search#:~:text=To%20access%20your%20property%20tax,with%20more%20explanation%20and%20information)). No record of this entity is found in Illinois corporate registration databases, suggesting it is a private landholding vehicle with no public-facing operations ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Research%20Your%20Property%20,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)). The LLC has not appeared in local news or court filings, indicating its activity is limited to passive land ownership (no development projects or public statements on record) ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Research%20Your%20Property%20,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns farmland only; no known community role or political activity; low public visibility

approach_recommendations.engage: Quietly engage through informal contact with owner or agent; emphasize respect for farming operations and offer assurances project won’t harm their land use

neighbors.name: McHenry Co. Conservation Dist.
neighbors.claims: The McHenry County Conservation District (MCCD) is a governmental entity created by voter referendum in 1971 to protect open space and natural resources ([mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://mchenrycountyhistory.org/day-mchenry-county-history#:~:text=,Woodstock%20Jaycees%20organized)). MCCD currently manages nearly 25,000 acres of land across the county, including about 6,646 acres of farmland under agricultural lease programs ([orgfarmlandsurvey.com](https://orgfarmlandsurvey.com/mchenry/#:~:text=,total%20acres)). The District’s mission is to preserve wildlife habitat, water quality, and scenic land; it often reviews development proposals for environmental impacts and advocates for mitigation or preservation measures ([www.mchenrydems.org](https://www.mchenrydems.org/mccd_proposition#:~:text=What%20is%20it%20about%3F)) ([mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://mchenrycountyhistory.org/day-mchenry-county-history#:~:text=,Woodstock%20Jaycees%20organized)). MCCD is well-established and respected locally, with taxing authority and a history of mobilizing public support for conservation funding (e.g., recent tax referenda) ([www.dailyherald.com](https://www.dailyherald.com/20241120/local-politics/mchenry-county-voters-approve-conservation-district-tax-request/#:~:text=Local%20Politics%20,McHenry%20County%20voters%20appear%20to)) ([www.mchenrycountyblog.com](https://www.mchenrycountyblog.com/2024/11/05/conservation-district-33-tax-hike-referendum-reported-losing-by-271-votes-with-all-precincts-counted/#:~:text=Conservation%20District%2033,the%20map%20showing%20the%20results)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Government agency owning extensive land; strong public mandate for conservation; ability to sway public opinion and officials on environmental grounds

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage MCCD leadership early to highlight project’s minimal environmental footprint; offer habitat enhancements or partnerships to align with their conservation goals; address any concerns about wildlife and open space openly to prevent opposition

neighbors.name: West Grant Develop Inc
neighbors.claims: West Grant Development, Inc. is an Illinois domestic corporation formed on May 5, 2005 ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/west-grant-development-inc/IL-64158619#:~:text=,05)). The company’s registered agent at formation was local attorney Donald F. Franz, and its initial officers included James Athans (President) and David Klesmith (Secretary) ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/west-grant-development-inc/IL-64158619#:~:text=,DAVID%20KLESMITH%20SAME%20Secretary)). West Grant Development Inc owns multiple adjacent parcels along West Grant Highway, indicating a strategic land position likely intended for future development or resale. The corporation has no visible business operations or website, and no public records of active development projects on its Marengo Township land (suggesting it is holding the property, possibly for speculative investment) ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/west-grant-development-inc/IL-64158619#:~:text=,DAVID%20KLESMITH%20SAME%20Secretary)) ([www.chicagocityscape.com](https://www.chicagocityscape.com/companies.php?company=James+Athans#:~:text=Chicago%20Cityscape%20,where%20James%20Athans%20has%20projects)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls several highway-frontage parcels; led by local business figures; potential resources for development but no public outreach to date

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify current decision-maker (e.g., surviving officer or agent) and discuss mutually beneficial options (buyout or joint venture); stress how proposed project could raise neighboring land values; monitor for any competitive development plans they might have

neighbors.name: Burma Rd Grain LLC
neighbors.claims: Burma Rd Grain LLC appears to be a privately-held Illinois farm entity owning a parcel on Burma Road in Marengo Township ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Museum%20www,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)). The LLC’s name suggests a focus on grain farming or storage, but it has no listed corporate presence or public information aside from county land records (no business website or news mentions). No state-level filings or UCC liens were found under this name, implying it operates as a family-run farm business without external financing or separate ventures ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Museum%20www,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)). The company’s activities seem limited to agriculture on its land, and it has not publicly stated any position on local development proposals (likely maintaining a low profile) ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Museum%20www,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Single-parcel farm ownership; no public or political role; influence confined to personal connections in farming community

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via local farm networks or cooperative to build trust; reassure that development will not impede farm access or drainage; offer any needed mitigation (e.g., dust control, buffer) to address their farming concerns

neighbors.name: John C Tr et al Martin
